etymology.description: Semantic: 門(門) (mén, "door") + Phonetic: 柬(柬) (jiǎn, "select") = door + phonetic marker -> block
etymology.interpretation: The character 闌(闌) (lán, "block") combines the semantic component 門(門) (mén, "door") to suggest a physical barrier, with the phonetic 柬(柬) (jiǎn, "select") which provides the pronunciation. The combination implies something that obstructs or closes a passage, like a door.

examples.chinese: 高大的石墙闌住了小径(高大的石牆闌住了小徑)。
examples.pinyin: Gāo dà de shí qiáng lán zhù le xiǎo jìng.
examples.english: The tall stone wall blocked the path.

examples.chinese: 暴风雨将至(暴風雨將至)，大树倒下闌住了去路(大樹倒下闌住了去路)。
examples.pinyin: Bào fēng yǔ jiāng zhì, dà shù dǎo xià lán zhù le qù lù.
examples.english: As the storm approached, the fallen tree blocked the way.
